Now this I would ≈øay, there is ≈øomething in it to be con≈øidered with re≈øpect to the time wherein Chri≈øt appeared vi≈øibly to the world, and the after-times wherein the Apo≈øtles did hold forth the≈øe great Doctrines of the Go≈øpel concerning Chri≈øt. And this we are to ≈øay, that in ≈øuch a time as that was, when this was the critical point as it were, the di≈øcriminating thing, in ≈øuch a time for any to make this Profe≈ø≈øion, and to hold forth this to be their Faith and Belief, that Je≈øus is the Chri≈øt, the Son of God, it was of high ≈øignification; and might very well, as to man, beget a comfortable confidence and hope concerning ≈øuch per≈øons, that certainly they were born of God, as to man, and according to rational Charity it might be very comfortable that ≈øuch per≈øons as did thus believe, and profe≈øs this to be their Faith and Belief, there were ≈øome ble≈ø≈øed beam upon their Souls; for mark you, it hath been thus in the world, and among the people of it concerning matters of God and Godline≈øs, that there hath been ≈øuch and ≈øuch a Truth, that hath been the Critical Truth, as I ≈øaid; that hath been, as I may ≈øo ≈øay, the Shibboleth whereby people are di≈øtingui≈øhed one from another. I allude to that pa≈ø≈øage in the Book of Judges, concerning the Gileadites; they made a

Now for per≈øons at ≈øuch time, wherein it was as much as their liberty, it may be their lives we ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ worth, to own that Je≈øus Chri≈øt was the Son of God, for per≈øons now ‚Ä¢ t ≈øuch a time to own this Je≈øus, that was in ≈øo mean a condition, to be the Chri≈øt, there is very much in it, infinitely more, than for per≈øons now to take up this profe≈ø≈øion.

Why? becau≈øe this Doctrine hath obtained in the world, and it is a Doctrine among Papi≈øts as well as Prote≈øtants; there is no ≈øuch danger now for per≈øons to be of this belief. But ≈øhall I ≈øay this, that for all that to believe this really according to the right account, and true genuine interpretation of Go≈øpel-believing, the ca≈øe is the ≈øame with them and with us at this day, ≈øetting a≈øide the con≈øideration of times and time; the danger then, and the encouragement now; the Ca≈øe is the ≈øame, Go≈øpel-believing of the≈øe truths according to a genuine interpretation of Go≈øpel-believing, it is the ≈øame now as then, and then as now: And therefore we mu≈øt con≈øider and look further.

I would put the≈øe few things to your Con≈øciences; You profe≈øs this to be your Faith, you believe that Je≈øus is the Chri≈øt, the Son of God, that he is come in the fle≈øh; the≈øe things you profe≈øs to believe, & if you do ≈øo indeed you are highly privileged people, ble≈ø≈øed of God, & ≈øhal be to all eternity but do you not mi≈øtake, Do you believe this, that Je≈øus is the Chri≈øt? Can you give ≈øuch an account of your ≈øelves, That you have not taken it up upon a common report, but are able to ≈øay, there hath been an inward Revelation made of the≈øe things to your Souls, that there hath been a ≈øanctified work of the Spirit upon your under≈øtanding, that you come to ≈øee into the my≈øtery of the≈øe Go≈øpel-Te≈øtimonies? When we give a≈ø≈øent to common Truths, but not with a common ≈øpirit, but in the ≈øtrength of an inward conviction, we a≈ø≈øent to it upon the account of an Unction that we have received from the Holy One; and we a≈ø≈øent to this and that truth upon the account of a Divine Authority which we ≈øee to be ≈øtampt upon it, and withall we finde that there are ≈øuitable workings of our heart in the loves, and de≈øires, and delights of them, to the≈øe Truths (as there will be a kindly working of the heart, where there is a right a≈ø≈øent ≈øuitable to the Truths a≈ø≈øented to;) as if there be a Threatning, the Soul a≈ø≈øents to it, and will tremble before God: If a Promi≈øe be made, or a Go≈øpel-Revelation, it will be accompanied with a holy rejoycing in God, that ever he ≈øhould make ≈øuch a Promi≈øe or Revelation; and then there will be a holy re≈øolution of Spirit, Come what will come, I will never part with this Truth; I have bought the Truth, that was my duty; and having bought it, I will never
≈øell it, that is my duty too; can we give ≈øuch an account as this? But then withal, let me a little further improve that which I have already ≈øpoke from the Chapter.

You ≈øay, this is your belief, that Je≈øus is the Chri≈øt, the Son of GOD; but can you give an account of tho≈øe priviledges that are entailed upon this belief? For you mu≈øt know that the priviledges which belong to ≈øuch, will ≈øerve as evidences that they are ≈øuch.

And then again, you profe≈øs to believe that Je≈øus is the Chri≈øt, the Son of God: Oh! but are you able to give an account that you have believed into this Je≈øus, and upon this Je≈øus?
